verses.roman:
prabhuke kahena--tomāra nā bujhi e līlā
āmā haite prasāda-pātra karilā kamalā

synonyms: prabhuke—unto the Lord; kahena—says; tomāra—Your; nā—do not; bujhi—I understand; e—these; līlā—pastimes; āmā—Myself; haite—more than; prasāda-pātra—object of favor; karilā—You did; kamalā—unto Kamalākānta Viśvāsa.
translation: Śrī Advaita Ācārya told Lord Caitanya, "l cannot understand Your transcendental pastimes. You have shown more favor to Kamalākānta than You generally show to Me.
